title: Authors and Citation
text: Rapha√´l Nussbaumer. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Nussbaumer R (2026). GeoLocatoR: R package GeoLocator Data Package. R package version 0.4.0, https://github.com/rafnuss/geolocator.
code: @Manual{,   title = {GeoLocatoR: R package for GeoLocator Data Package},   author = {Rapha√´l Nussbaumer},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.4.0},   url = {https://github.com/rafnuss/geolocator}, }

what: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: GeoLocatoR R package helps create, use, share geolocator data easy way.

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: GeoLocatoR designed help create work GeoLocator Data Package (GeoLocator DP), standardized format geolocator data follows Data Package standard, ensuring data organized, accessible, ready share.

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: Creates GeoLocator Data Package: Create geolocator datapackage object, add resources (data), write data package preferred directory. , read existing data package directory Zenodo. Works Seamlessly GeoPressureTemplate: GeoLocatoR compatible GeoPressureTemplate ‚Äî template repository analyzing geolocator data using GeoPressureR. Use together streamline analysis maintain standardized project structure. Supports Swiss Ornithological Institute Data: Special functions designed deal internal SOI data. See vignette. Built frictionless-r: package built using frictionless-r package, adhering Frictionless Data standards open data.

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: Data Package lightweight format packaging data using Data Package standard. provides framework organizing data files, metadata, descriptive information consistent reusable manner. geolocator data, ensures information tagged birds, movements, associated metadata bundled single exchangeable package. Learn GeoLocator DP standard .

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: can install GeoLocatoR GitHub:

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: Learn use GeoLocatoR dedicated part GeoPressureManual.

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: use GeoLocatoR research, please cite follows: Nussbaumer, R. (2024). GeoLocatoR: R package GeoLocator Data Package. https://github.com/rafnuss/geolocator

what: GeoLocatoR: R package for GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî GeoLocatoR-package
title: GeoLocatoR: R package for GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî GeoLocatoR-package
text: R package help create read geolocator data using GeoLocator Data Package standard.

title: GeoLocatoR: R package for GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî GeoLocatoR-package
text: Maintainer: Rapha√´l Nussbaumer rafnuss@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Add Geolocator DP resources from a GeoPressureTemplate ‚Äî add_gldp_geopressuretemplate
title: Add Geolocator DP resources from a GeoPressureTemplate ‚Äî add_gldp_geopressuretemplate
text: function adds possible resources GeolocatoR Data Package reading data GeoPressureTemplate directories files. function performs following steps: "interim" ,  reads interim ".RData" files, extract variables add corresponding resources package (measurements, twilights, staps, paths, edges, pressurepaths). Generated automatically temporary tags observations tables param interim file. "raw-data" , search tag_id data/raw-data/ included interim. use least tag_create possible tag_label tag_set_map using config.yml .also generate update tags observations table tag data. Reads tags.csv (tags.xlsx present) observations.csv (observations.xlsx present) ./data directory exist overwrite previously generated tags observations. can exclude interim file raw-tag folder included package starting file name "_". possible mix tag read "interim" "raw-data" simultaneously. can find information use function GeoPressureManual

title: Add Geolocator DP resources from a GeoPressureTemplate ‚Äî add_gldp_geopressuretemplate
Add Geolocator DP resources from a GeoPressureTemplate ‚Äî add_gldp_geopressuretemplate
text: pkg GeoLocator Data Package object. directory character string specifying geopressuretemplate directory. character vector specifying source data files. Either "raw-tag" (creating tag based data data/raw-tag/) "interim" data data/interim.

title: Add Geolocator DP resources from a GeoPressureTemplate ‚Äî add_gldp_geopressuretemplate
text: updated GLDP package object new resources

what: Add a Geolocator Data Resource ‚Äî add_gldp_resource
title: Add a Geolocator Data Resource ‚Äî add_gldp_resource
text: function adds resource geolocator data package ensures data conforms schema defined resource. wrapper frictionless::add_resource  first validate schema potentially modify data frame data adding package. specifically, function adjusts data frame according schema's fieldsMatch property also cast type/class columns provided according . cast_type. Note function generally recommended used resources can added modified respective accessors functions.

title: Add a Geolocator Data Resource ‚Äî add_gldp_resource
code: add_gldp_resource(   package,   resource_name,   data,   cast_type = FALSE,   replace = FALSE,   delim = "," )

title: Add a Geolocator Data Resource ‚Äî add_gldp_resource
text: package GeoLocator Data Package object resource added. resource_name character string specifying name resource. name used locate schema file. data data frame containing data added resource. data frame adjusted according schema. cast_type logical value indicating whether data frame cast types specified schema. Defaults FALSE. replace TRUE, added resource replace existing resource name. delim Single character used separate fields CSV file(s), e.g. \t tab delimited file. set delimiter resource Table Dialect, read functions .  know read file(s).

title: Add a Geolocator Data Resource ‚Äî add_gldp_resource
text: updated GeoLocator Data Package object new resource added.

what: Add GLDP SOI Data to a Package ‚Äî add_gldp_soi
title: Add GLDP SOI Data to a Package ‚Äî add_gldp_soi
text: function adds data Swiss Ornithological Institute (SOI) package. includes tags, measurements, observations based provided data frame directory data. function also handles missing directories updates package accordingly. See example use tutorial.

title: Add GLDP SOI Data to a Package ‚Äî add_gldp_soi
Add GLDP SOI Data to a Package ‚Äî add_gldp_soi
text: pkg package object data added. gdl data frame containing SOI data. Must include columns like OrderName, GDL_ID, relevant fields tags, measurements, observations. See read_gdl information. directory_data character string specifying path directory data files located. directory used locate match GDL_IDs corresponding directories. generate_observations logical value indicating whether create pre-filled observations missing values (date, locations, etc... assuming equipment retrieval.

title: Add GLDP SOI Data to a Package ‚Äî add_gldp_soi
text: updated package object added resources.

title: Add GLDP SOI Data to a Package ‚Äî add_gldp_soi
text: function performs following steps: Checks retrieves directory information GDL_ID/tag_id. Creates GeoPressureR tag data possible Extract measurements add resources pkg Compute tags.csv observations.csv gdl add resources .

what: Convert GeoPressureTemplate config.yml to tibble ‚Äî config2tibble
title: Convert GeoPressureTemplate config.yml to tibble ‚Äî config2tibble
text: Reads GeoPressureTemplate config.yml file converts tibble format one row per tag columns configuration parameter. useful comparing configurations across multiple tags programmatic analysis tag settings.

title: Convert GeoPressureTemplate config.yml to tibble ‚Äî config2tibble
Convert GeoPressureTemplate config.yml to tibble ‚Äî config2tibble
text: file Character string specifying path config.yml file. Defaults "config.yml" current directory, value R_CONFIG_FILE environment variable set. filter_return Logical. TRUE (default), columns vary across tags returned. FALSE, configuration columns included even value tags.

title: Convert GeoPressureTemplate config.yml to tibble ‚Äî config2tibble
text: tibble::tibble() one row per tag ID columns configuration parameter. exact columns returned depend configuration file structure filter_return parameter.

title: Convert GeoPressureTemplate config.yml to tibble ‚Äî config2tibble
text: function uses GeoPressureR::geopressuretemplate_config() internally parse tag's configuration. flattens nested list structure applies appropriate type conversions parameter (e.g., converting dates strings, functions deparsed representation). function handles various GeoPressureR configuration parameters including: Tag creation settings (manufacturer, file paths, crop dates) Labeling parameters (flight/stap duration warnings) Map settings (extent, known locations, pressure/light thresholds) Graph creation movement model parameters Bird characteristics (mass, wing measurements) Wind environmental data settings

title: Convert GeoPressureTemplate config.yml to tibble ‚Äî config2tibble
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Read config from default location cfg <- config2tibble()  # Read from specific file cfg <- config2tibble("path/to/config.yml")  # Include all columns even if they don't vary cfg_full <- config2tibble(filter_return = FALSE)  # View which parameters differ across tags View(cfg) } # }

title: Create a GeoPressureTemplate Project ‚Äî create_geopressuretemplate
text: Initializes geopressure template project creating specified directory structure populating essential files, including DESCRIPTION file, README, license, data. function sets project directory ensures necessary components place geopressure analysis project.

title: Create a GeoPressureTemplate Project ‚Äî create_geopressuretemplate
Create a GeoPressureTemplate Project ‚Äî create_geopressuretemplate
text: path character string specifying destination directory project created. last folder give name project. pkg GeoLocatoR Datapackage object (optional) open TRUE, package opened new RStudio session.

title: Create a GeoPressureTemplate Project ‚Äî create_geopressuretemplate
text: path created project directory.

title: Create a GeoPressureTemplate Project ‚Äî create_geopressuretemplate
text: Upon execution, function performs following steps: Creates project directory. Generates DESCRIPTION file using metadata pkg. Creates README file outlines project details. Generates LICENSE file based specified licenses. Writes relevant data files project structure.

what: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
text: function create geolocator data package R object. arguments functions correspond standard geolocator Data Package properties. function initiate Geolocator Data Package R object. function similar frictionless::create_package() required specific metadata provided arguments function rather list descriptor. arguments correspond field datapackage.json. geolocator data package also Data Package object created frictionless::create_package()  (?) functions frictionless package work. Note function add data resources, returns empty shell project level metadata.

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
code: create_gldp(   title = "",   contributors = list(list(title = "")),   embargo = "1970-01-01",   licenses = list(list(name = "CC-BY-4.0", title = "Creative Commons Attribution 4.0",     path = "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/")),   id = NULL,   description = NULL,   version = NULL,   relatedIdentifiers = NULL,   grants = NULL,   keywords = NULL,   created = format(as.POSIXct(Sys.time(), tz = "UTC"), "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ"),   bibliographicCitation = NULL,   schema = NULL )

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
text: title string providing title one sentence description package. plain text (markup), capitalised like title, end period less 65 characters. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. contributors list contributors, contributor list properties including least title also optionally givenName, familyName, path, email, roles, organization. See Geolocator DP, Data Package specification R Packages. embargo End date embargo ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DD). repository restrict access data end embargo period; time, content become publicly available automatically. Default "1970-01-01" (embargo). See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. licenses list licenses data provided. Usually, single license sufficient preferred. sure, check Creative Commons License Chooser  Open Data Commons . name path must provided. Default CC--4.0 license. See Geolocator DP  Data Package specification. id globally unique identifier package, typically DOI link corresponding Zenodo repository can reserved prior publication . Defaults NULL. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. description markdown-formatted string describing package. can (!) use multiple sentences, limited single paragraph. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. version (optional) version string identifying version package, following Semantic Versioning. Defaults "1.0.0". See Geolocator DP Data Package specification Data Package Version recipe. relatedIdentifiers (optional) list related identifiers package. related identifier list properties relationType, relatedIdentifier, relatedIdentifierType. See Geolocator DP Camtrap DP specification . grants (optional) list grants funded creation package. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. keywords (optional) list keywords assist users searching package. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. created Datetime created. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. bibliographicCitation (optional) string providing citation package. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. schema (optional) URL JSON Table Schema describes data package. Defaults GeoLocator Data Package profile. See Data Package specification .

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
text: Geolocator Data Package object containing metadata.

code: # Create a Data Package with all possible metadata pkg <- create_gldp(   title = "Geolocator Data Package example",   contributors = list(     list(       title = "Rapha√´l Nussbaumer",       roles = c("ContactPerson", "DataCurator", "ProjectLeader")     ),     list(       title = "Yann Rime",       givenName = "Yann",       familyName = "Rime",       path = "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2745-0557",       email = "yann.rime@vogelwarte.ch",       roles = c("Researcher"),       organization = "Swiss Ornithological Institute"     )   ),   embargo = "2025-01-01",   licenses = list(list(name = "CC-BY-4.0")),   id = "https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13829929",   description = NULL,   version = "1.0.1",   relatedIdentifiers = list(     list(       relationType = "IsPartOf",       relatedIdentifier = "10.5281/zenodo.11207081",       relatedIdentifierType = "DOI"     ),     list(       relationType = "IsSupplementTo",       relatedIdentifier = "10.1007/s00114-018-1566-9",       relatedIdentifierType = "DOI"     )   ),   grants = c("Swiss National Foundation grant no. 354251"),   keywords = c("Woodland Kingfisher", "intra-african", "multi-sensor geolocator"),   created = "2024-05-17",   bibliographicCitation = "Nussbaumer, R., & Rime, Y. (2024). Woodland Kingfisher: Migration   route and timing of South African Woodland Kingfisher (v1.1). Zenodo.   https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11207141" )

what: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to Darwin Core ‚Äî gldp_to_dwc
title: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to Darwin Core ‚Äî gldp_to_dwc
text: Transforms GeoLocator Data Package Darwin Core Archive. resulting CSV files can uploaded IPT publication GBIF. meta.xml file included well. See gldp_to_eml() create eml.xml file.

title: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to Darwin Core ‚Äî gldp_to_dwc
Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to Darwin Core ‚Äî gldp_to_dwc
text: package GeoLocator Data Package object. directory Path local directory write file(s) . NULL, data frame returned instead, can useful extending/adapting Darwin Core mapping writing readr::write_csv(). path_type type path use occurrence data. One "most_likely", "mean_simulation", "median_simulation", "geopressureviz". simulation types, mean median position (lat/lon) calculated tag_id-stap_id combination across simulated paths. Defaults "most_likely". See paths details.

title: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to Darwin Core ‚Äî gldp_to_dwc
text: occurrence.csv file written disk. Invisibly, occurrence data frame.

title: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to Darwin Core ‚Äî gldp_to_dwc
text: Data transformed Occurrence core. transformation combines data three resources: tags: metadata device deployment staps: stationary periods temporal information paths: spatial positions estimated stationary period following terms set package metadata: datasetName: Title provided package$title. datasetID: Identifier provided package$id. rightsHolder: Rights holder provided package$contributors (contributor "rightsHolder" role). rightsHolder role found, field NA. license: License name provided package$licenses. Key features Darwin Core transformation: Stationary periods (staps) treated events, position occurrence representing bird's location period. occurrence represents one stationary period path data, filtered path_type. eventDate expressed ISO 8601 interval (start/end) representing duration stationary period. basisOfRecord set "MachineObservation" data derived automated geolocator sensors. samplingProtocol set "geolocator". geodeticDatum "EPSG:4326" (WGS84). scientificName taken tags$scientific_name. organismID set ring_number track individual birds across multiple observations deployments. occurrenceID unique identifier combining tag_id stap_id. individualCount set 1. occurrenceStatus set "present". sex lifeStage included available tags resource. coordinateUncertaintyInMeters calculated simulation path types ("mean_simulation" "median_simulation") 95th percentile distance simulation aggregated center.

what: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to EML ‚Äî gldp_to_eml
title: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to EML ‚Äî gldp_to_eml
text: Transforms GeoLocator Data Package Ecological Metadata Language (EML). resulting EML file can uploaded IPT publication GBIF /OBIS. corresponding Darwin Core Archive can created gldp_to_dwc().

title: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to EML ‚Äî gldp_to_eml
Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to EML ‚Äî gldp_to_eml
text: package GeoLocator Data Package object. directory Path local directory write files .

title: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to EML ‚Äî gldp_to_eml
text: eml.xml file written disk. Invisibly, EML::eml object.

title: Transform a GeoLocator Data Package to EML ‚Äî gldp_to_eml
text: Metadata derived GeoLocator Data Package transformed EML. following properties set: title: Package title provided package$title. abstract: Package description provided package$description. pubDate: Publication year extracted package$created. creator: Contributors roles "ProjectLeader", "Researcher", "DataCurator" provided package$contributors. contact: Contributors role "ContactPerson" provided package$contributors. associatedParty: contributors provided package$contributors, including role "RightsHolder". intellectualRights: License information package$licenses. keywords: Keywords provided package$keywords. packageId: Package identifier provided package$id. ID provided, UUID generated. result, new DOI created publishing GBIF package$id contains DOI. Coverage information: temporalCoverage: Date range package$temporal (available), derived measurement timestamps. geographicCoverage: Bounding box package$spatial (available), calculated locations observations, paths, pressurepaths. taxonomicCoverage: Species list package$taxonomic (available), derived unique scientific names tags. Methods: methodStep: Generic description indicating data processed using GeoLocator Data Package standard. following EML properties set: type subtype update frequency publishing organization project data citations collection data

what: Convert GeoLocator Data Package to GeoPressureR tag object(s) ‚Äî gldp_to_tag
title: Convert GeoLocator Data Package to GeoPressureR tag object(s) ‚Äî gldp_to_tag
text: function converts GeoLocator Data Package (gldp) object one GeoPressureR tag objects. gldp structure contains data potentially multiple tags, GeoPressureR tag object represents single tag's sensor data.

title: Convert GeoLocator Data Package to GeoPressureR tag object(s) ‚Äî gldp_to_tag
Convert GeoLocator Data Package to GeoPressureR tag object(s) ‚Äî gldp_to_tag
text: pkg GeoLocator Data Package object (class "geolocatordp"), typically created read_gldp() create_gldp(). tag_id Character vector specifying tag(s) extract. NULL (default), tags package converted.

title: Convert GeoLocator Data Package to GeoPressureR tag object(s) ‚Äî gldp_to_tag
text: tag_id single value package contains one tag, returns single GeoPressureR tag object. Otherwise, returns named list tag objects, names correspond tag_id values. GeoPressureR tag object contains: param: parameter object (see GeoPressureR::param_create()) pressure: data.frame columns date value (pressure data available) light: data.frame columns date value (light data available) acceleration: data.frame columns date, value (activity measure), optionally pitch (activity/pitch data available) temperature_external: data.frame columns date value (external temperature data available) temperature_internal: data.frame columns date value (internal temperature data available) magnetic: data.frame columns date, magnetic_x, magnetic_y, magnetic_z (magnetic data available) stap: data.frame columns stap_id, start, end, optionally known_lat, known_lon, include (stationary periods defined) twilight: data.frame columns twilight, rise, optionally label (twilight data available)

title: Convert GeoLocator Data Package to GeoPressureR tag object(s) ‚Äî gldp_to_tag
text: function extracts sensor data gldp's measurements resource converts format expected GeoPressureR. conversion includes: Filtering measurements tag_id Reshaping data long format (measurements) wide format (sensor-specific data.frames) Combining related sensors (e.g., activity pitch acceleration; magnetic_x/y/z magnetic) Adding stationary period (stap) data available package Adding twilight data available package Setting appropriate parameter values gldp metadata Sensor mapping GLDP GeoPressureR: pressure ‚Üí pressure (date, value) light ‚Üí light (date, value) activity + pitch ‚Üí acceleration (date, value, pitch) value = activity temperature-external ‚Üí temperature_external (date, value) temperature-internal ‚Üí temperature_internal (date, value) magnetic_x/y/z ‚Üí magnetic (date, magnetic_x, magnetic_y, magnetic_z) Additional data extracted: staps table ‚Üí tag$stap (stap_id, start, end, known_lat, known_lon, include) twilights table ‚Üí tag$twilight (twilight, rise, label) Note resulting tag object manufacturer = "datapackage" parameters, consistent GeoPressureR handles data GeoLocator Data Packages.

title: Convert GeoLocator Data Package to GeoPressureR tag object(s) ‚Äî gldp_to_tag
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Read a gldp from a file pkg <- read_gldp("path/to/datapackage.json")  # Convert all tags tags <- gldp_to_tag(pkg)  # Convert a specific tag tag <- gldp_to_tag(pkg, tag_id = "18LX")  # Convert multiple specific tags tags <- gldp_to_tag(pkg, tag_id = c("18LX", "18IC")) } # }

title: Merge Two GeoLocator Data Packages ‚Äî merge_gldp
text: Merges two GeoLocator Data Package objects (x y) single combined package. metadata properties packages merged according specific rules, resource data combined based presence either package.

title: Merge Two GeoLocator Data Packages ‚Äî merge_gldp
Merge Two GeoLocator Data Packages ‚Äî merge_gldp
text: x GeoLocator Data Package object. y GeoLocator Data Package object.

text: GeoLocator Data Package object containing merged data x y.

title: Merge Two GeoLocator Data Packages ‚Äî merge_gldp
text: Metadata merging rules: title: Combined packages, separated "/". contributors: Combined packages, duplicates removed. embargo: Set latest date packages. licenses: Combined packages, duplicates removed. id: Removed merged package. description: Combined two separate paragraphs, newline separator. version: Removed merged package. relatedIdentifiers: Combined, duplicates removed. grants: Combined packages, duplicates removed. keywords: Combined packages, duplicates removed. created: Set current timestamp time merging. bibliographicCitation: Removed merged package. Custom properties x retained merged package. Resource merging logic: resource checked presence x y. Data sources combined resource exists either x y. Resources included exist least one packages.

what: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
text: set functions facilitates reading combining Geolocator Data (GDL) associated order information various sources. main function, read_gdl(), allows reading data Access file directly separate CSV files containing GDL data order information. returns data frame integrates GDL data summarized order details.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
code: read_gdl(access_file = NA, data_file = NA, order_file = NA, filter_col = TRUE)  read_gdl_orders(order_file)  read_gdl_data(data_file)  read_gdl_access(   access_file,   data_file = tempfile("GDL_Data", fileext = ".csv"),   order_file = tempfile("GDL_Orders", fileext = ".csv") )

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
text: access_file string specifying path Access file containing GDL data order information. provided, takes precedence data_file order_file. Defaults NA.  ¬ß data_file string specifying path GDL data file. Required access_file provided. Defaults NA. order_file string specifying path GDL order file. Required access_file provided. Defaults NA. filter_col logical value character vector. TRUE, predefined set columns selected. FALSE, columns included. Alternatively, character vector can passed specify columns select. Defaults TRUE.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
text: data frame combining GDL data summarized order information. data frame includes columns OrderName, Client, NumberDelivered, GDL_ID, Species, , depending value filter_col.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
text: read_gdl() function primary interface reading combining GDL data orders. can read Access file separate data order files. Access file provided, read_gdl_access() function used extract GDL data order information. Otherwise, read_gdl_data() read_gdl_orders() functions employed read data specified CSV files. read_gdl(): Reads GDL order data, either Access file separate CSV files, returns combined data frame. read_gdl_orders(): Reads GDL order information CSV file, including columns like OrderID, OrderName, Species, Client, NumberDelivered. read_gdl_data(): Reads GDL data CSV file, including columns like DataID, OrderName, GDL_ID, Species, spatial temporal information. read_gdl_access(): Extracts GDL data order information Access database file exports temporary CSV files.

title: Read a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî read_gldp
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Local file read_gldp("datapackage.json") # Zenodo DOI read_gldp("10.5281/zenodo.15259676") # Zenodo DOI URL read_gldp("https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15259676") # Zenodo record link read_gldp("https://zenodo.org/records/15259676") # Zenodo record number read_gldp("15259676") } # } # Read a datapackage.json file pkg <- read_gldp("https://zenodo.org/records/14099115/files/datapackage.json")  pkg #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ A GeoLocator Data Package (vmain)  #> ‚Ä¢ title: "GeoLocator Data Package: South African Woodland Kingfisher" #> ‚Ä¢ contributors: #>   Rapha√´l Nussbaumer (rafnuss@gmail.com) (Researcher, ProjectLeader) - #>   <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8185-1020> #>   Yann Rime (yann.rime@vogelwarte.ch) (Researcher, Contributor) - #>   <https://orcid.org/0009-0005-7264-6753> #> ‚Ä¢ embargo: 1970-01-01 #> ‚Ä¢ licenses: #>   CC BY 4.0 #> ‚Ä¢ id: <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13829929> #> ‚Ä¢ version: "1.1" #> ‚Ä¢ relatedIdentifiers: #>   IsPartOf <10.5281/zenodo.11207081> #>   IsSupplementTo <> #> ‚Ä¢ grants: "Swiss Ornithological Intitute" #> ‚Ä¢ keywords: "Woodland Kingfisher", "intra-african", and "multi-sensor #>   geolocator" #> ‚Ä¢ created: 2024-11-12 12:58:55 #> ‚Ä¢ spatial: #> ‚Ä¢ temporal: "2017-01-10" to "2019-09-28" #> ‚Ä¢ taxonomic: "Halcyon senegalensis" #> ‚Ä¢ numberTags: #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ 8 resources  #> ‚Ä¢ tags (n=24) #> ‚Ä¢ observations (n=63) #> ‚Ä¢ measurements (n=1,924,975) #> ‚Ä¢ twilights (n=3,262) #> ‚Ä¢ staps (n=223) #> ‚Ä¢ paths (n=22,523) #> ‚Ä¢ edges (n=22,018) #> ‚Ä¢ pressurepaths (n=224,828) #> Use `unclass()` to print the Geolocator Data Package as a list.

what: Update computed metadata of a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî update_gldp
title: Update computed metadata of a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî update_gldp
text: function update/create following metadata existing GeoLocator Data Package based data contained within package. update_gldp_temporal(): Sets pkg$temporal date range datetime values measurements resource, available. update_gldp_spatial(): Sets pkg$spatial GeoJSON bounding box locations found observation, paths pressurepaths. update_gldp_taxonomic(): Sets pkg$taxonomic unique tags$scientific_name found observations. update_gldp_number_tags(): update_gldp_bibliographic_citation(): Sets pkg$bibliographicCitation formatted utils::bibentry() current package. update_gldp_reference_location(): Sets pkg$reference_location field median latitude longitude values observations resource, available. update_gldp_metadata: Re-arrange order properties according order schema update_gldp performs functions mentioned .

title: Update computed metadata of a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî update_gldp
code: update_gldp(pkg)  update_gldp_temporal(pkg)  update_gldp_spatial(pkg)  update_gldp_taxonomic(pkg)  update_gldp_number_tags(pkg)  update_gldp_bibliographic_citation(pkg, ...)  update_gldp_reference_location(pkg)  update_gldp_metadata(pkg)
